Posts.Content: morning Dreamthief, no not been suffering for a while...if I lie flat and it makes me dizzy that dizziness goes away after a few seconds....but this dizziness has stayed. In the past I have suffered with labyrinthitis xx
Posts.Title: Dizziness

Posts.Content: I had to have meds for it....feels similar just not as severe as before xx
Posts.Title: Dizziness

Posts.Content: and the dizziness has stayed with me since then xx
Posts.Title: Dizziness

Posts.Content: Hi everyone....just wondered if anyone suffered dizzy spells during radiotherapy? Xx
Posts.Title: Dizziness

Posts.Content: update.....saw radio onco and he said position im lying in could have triggered y previous problems and to go see gp for tablets I've previously had. Its not a side effect of treatment...but brought on by position in lying in and tilting my head xx
Posts.Title: Dizziness

Posts.Content: I dont lie flat at home because it makes me feel dizzy so could be the position etc when lying down. I'm there tomorrow so will mention it to rad team. I had my first on Thursday and woke up Friday dizzy as soon as got out of bed. And on Friday when I sat up after radio I went really dizzy xx
Posts.Title: Dizziness

Posts.Content: Had my test results, its Invasive Ductal looks like Stage 1 Grade 2. Lots of info given to me....lumpectomy followed by radiotherapy. They will be taking some lymph nodes too and will know more after lumpectomy. Feeling sad but not broken xxx
Posts.Title: Test Results

Posts.Content: Needaname, Hi ya, thankyou for sharing with me and responding I really appreciate it. Mypreliminary diagnosis is grade 1 stage 2 invasive ductal 22mm x 15mm. Will no properly/more when I have lumpectomy. Still not got HER2 results back yet....but I'm hoping and praying a lumpectomy and rad therapy and meds after will do the job. I'm holding off telling her for as long as I can because her happy carefree face helps me get through if you know what I mean. So once lump out and I know more info I will decide then what to do. I've kept it to a select few people because normality is helping me keep strong. I love your attitude and positivity. We can't change it or make it go away...so we fight and crack on. I sincerely wish you all the best with your treatment. We've got this! x
Posts.Title: Test Results

Posts.Content: I wont know anymore until after lumpectomy, he said will be anytime within next 31 days xx
Posts.Title: Test Results

Posts.Content: Thanks Dreamthief. Its such a scary and daunting thing but I'm doing my darndest to be strong xx
Posts.Title: Test Results

Posts.Content: Thanks JoDec. I've only told a few people....im just wondering now how do I tackle telling other family members and friends but most importantly my 11 year old daughter. I'm a single parent (always have been) and me and my daughter are so close. I want to keep it from her for as long as possible because I don't know where to start if I tried to tell her. I just want to shelter her from it so her life remains 'normal' xx
Posts.Title: Test Results

Posts.Content: Thanks JoDec, yes she knows all about cancer. Someone she knew recently passed away after battling cancer and a friend of the family is battlng BC....and my uncle just battled cancer. She will be so scared and truth is I don't even know my survival statistic xxx
Posts.Title: Test Results

Posts.Content: Hi everyone how long after lumpectomy did you use e45 cream? Skin around and on my nipple looks dry...but it could just be from the glue...they cut half way round my nipple to get to my lump then glued it. When I've been showering I've just been letting the water run over my wound...i have not washed the breast. And around the nipple still has the blue pen mark there cos I cant scrub/wash it to remove it cos of the glue/stitches. Just wondered if e45 would affect it. Also I got a rash at side of armpit where its numb...anyone else get that? Xx .
Posts.Title: Dry skin/healing

Posts.Content: Thankyou Jac I didn't want to do anything to hinder the healing...didn't want my nipple popping open lol xxx
Posts.Title: Dry skin/healing

Posts.Content: Thankyou Leolady56 I'm putting cream on rash which is working wonders but I will just leave my boob alone til I've seen someone (they told me within two weeks). So til then I will just let water run over it but leave it alone otherwise xxx
Posts.Title: Dry skin/healing

Posts.Content: Thankyou Aimee will do. Glad your ok xxx

Posts.Content: Hi Aimee good luck and let us know how you get on xxx

Posts.Content: I hope it goes quickly for you how long did the chemo part of it take? Is it taking longer because of cold cap? Xxx

Posts.Content: Thankyou I didn't know how to tag either xx
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Good luck APRILLEE xx
Posts.Title: FIRST CHEMO

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, had my results from WLE and sentinel biopsy. Stage 2 invasive ductal. They took 2 nodes and cells were found in both. Got an appointment this week to see someone else as was told I will need chemo, radiation and tablets for 10 years. I'm sure she said I will have 4 sessions (cyles) of chemo.....so now I feel scared and lost as I wanted to dodge the chemo bullet. Is a session/cyle one session of chemo then 3 week off? Xx
Posts.Title: Going to be starting chemo

Posts.Content: Thankyou Dreamthief, no don't know which drugs yet...ive got an appointment this Friday. Does it make everyone feel ill all the time, or sometimes...or do you feel better a few days after? And oh my days...where do I start with hair loss :-( xx
Posts.Title: Going to be starting chemo

Posts.Content: Thankyou Sarah and the best of luck to you too xxx
Posts.Title: Going to be starting chemo

Posts.Content: Sending you massive hugs Shellian ❤ xxxx
Posts.Title: I just cant take anymore

Posts.Content: Thankyou Kathryn.b and I'm sending you all my love and well wishes for your up coming op ❤ you've got this! Xxx
Posts.Title: mixed emotions

Posts.Content: Good luck Kathryn.b thinking of you xxx
Posts.Title: mixed emotions

Posts.Content: Thankyou mistymoley, your 100% percent right. I've boxed it all up now its all coming out. Just crazy dark thoughts where I don't need to go ❤ xx
Posts.Title: mixed emotions

Posts.Content: Hi everyone its been a few days since lumpectomy, and I'm not sure what's going on in my mind. I feel anxious, sad, fearful yet glad its over and I have this paranoia about family members getting BC. Up to this point I've had a back bone of steel but right now I feel like a rollercoaster over worry and anxiety.i thought id feel elated but I just feel unsettled and keep thinking all sorts. Is it just me?? My mind on over drive. Yesterday the emotions started and I just feel like my stomach in somersaults and heart in my mouth. And I keep thinking what if my family gets BC. I've been carrying on being up beat but inside I want to run away so no one has to be around me (if that makes sense). Sorry for the downer I just cant say this to those supporting me. Urgh I'm such a whinger xxx
Posts.Title: mixed emotions

Posts.Content: Thankyou Carolyn. I'm starting to feel a bit stronger. My appointment is on Monday, so I'm going to enjoy mothers day tomorrow and keep my mind and myself busy xxx
Posts.Title: worry

Posts.Content: Hi ya, my appointment is on Monday. I'm so scared but I'm trying to be strong. I've never felt such anxiety and dread before....but ill be dammed if I'm gonna let it spoil mothers day tomorrow. How did you get on at clinic? Hope you had good news? Xxx
Posts.Title: worry

Posts.Content: Really exhausted and not slept in days. Trying to be normal to everyone around me whilst inside I'm falling apart. I found a lump in my right breast (not massive, but not small either) and doctor referring me to breast clinic. She said she was concerned because it seems stuck to the skin. Its tender too. I'm so scared, I'm a single parent with a young girl
Posts.Title: worry

Posts.Content: Thankyou ❤ you guys are all amazing xxx
Posts.Title: worry

Posts.Content: Thankyou so much ❤ all of you are absolutely amazing, and being here in this group has helped me gain some strength. I was so shocked and scared (still am scared) My appointment is on Monday. Thankyou for your welcome and kind words. Its greatly appreciated xxx
Posts.Title: worry

Posts.Content: Well 4th chemo yesterday....just two more to go....i hope it goes quick! I cant believe I'm nearly there. I just want it over and done with now. All the appointments, all the treatment....im ready to get my life back. I will be having radio therapy afterwards but I'm just looking forward to getting chemo out the way xxx
Posts.Title: chemo finish line approaching

Posts.Content: Hi Cathy no I wasn't given injections but the lady next to me was. Not sure why got antibiotics to take every day...to be honest I didn't ask....just took what I was given. Yes for whole cylce weirdly enough. Will ask more questions next cycle xx
Posts.Title: Through first week of 1st Cyle of fec-t

Posts.Content: Hi Helen, no I don't work in a school environment...i have a child that's off because of school holidays...thats why I'm off this week. Sorry I must have worded wrong what I previously wrote xx
Posts.Title: Through first week of 1st Cyle of fec-t

Posts.Content: Before I had my chemo I had a one to one with the head Chemo nurse. I went through my personal situation with her...im a single working parent with a very small family unit. My Childs father is not on the scene so there is just me. I told her my fears....nausea and getting ill......because no matter how I'm feeling I've still got to be able to function as a parent and would still like to work if possible because I need as much normality as possible to get through this. She was the one who sorts meds and checks bloods and administers the chemo....so I will ask her about the injections because when i previously met my oncologist he took 3 personal calls on his mobile during my appointment and was very distracted, and my BCN is not approachable and tells me different things each time we talk...thats if I can get hold of her. So far out of my whole experience the only person that has shown me any understanding, kindness and help was the chemo nurse so I'm sure the antibiotics are for a good reason...but I will ask. Obviously new to chemo I didn't know any different xx
Posts.Title: Through first week of 1st Cyle of fec-t

Posts.Title: Through first week of 1st Cyle of fec-t

Posts.Content: Good on you for being strong and requesting change!! I've got an appointment to see onco a few days before next cycle....I will ask him any questions I may have...but to be honest I just trust my chemo nurse now and I can call her before next cycle...she is great. I will ask her why no injections but I got antibiotics xx
Posts.Title: Through first week of 1st Cyle of fec-t

Posts.Content: Yesterday was exactly a week ago I had my first cyle of chemo. All meds helped with side effects....i drank plenty of water and ate whatever I fancied when I fancied. My meds were anti sickness, steroids and I was given antibiotics to take every day for 21 days. Mouth feels weird...almost textured in parts which may sound strange but I'm using mouthwash every day to help try not to get ulcers. I felt tired and dizzy for a good few days...but lack of sleep was not helping. Every day I wake up and think "I'm on chemo" and got a wave of panic...but it subsides. Although I was scared, tired and emotionally drained I've plodded on...been out for walks, been on a day out, been out for a meal....im still scared...but I'm not beaten. I'm staying positive...im just still trying to get my head around how to look like me when my hair goes...will I look natural, will people be able to tell etc. I have a wig which is nice but cant wear it yet cos just slides off my hair. I'm back to work next week...just off this week because its school holiday and I was booked off this week before I was even diagnosed with BC. I must say that throughout my journey you guys have been invaluable!!! None of us deserve to go through this...but having you amazing people around day and night makes this journey less lonely and gives me so much comfort and inspiration! Xx
Posts.Title: Through first week of 1st Cyle of fec-t

Posts.Content: Thankyou Cathy I will. The woman next to me was being shown how to inject herself and how to discard the needles etc. I just got anti sickness, steroids and antibiotics. I will def give a call...especially if the injections are important xx

Posts.Title: Through first week of 1st Cyle of fec-t

Posts.Content: They took 2 and found cells in both. Nothing was found on ultrasound so I was shocked because I was hoping to dodge the chemo and just have radiation and tablets...no one had mentioned chemo to me til this Monday so I'm still in shock absorbing it all. When I go this Friday to see oncologist they will apparently give me details about where and how to obtain wig because I haven't got a clue. Just feels a panicked rush for me...told chemo Monday (so in shock) had physio on Tuesday followed by being at work (Still in shock) and today I'm googling local micro blading salons xxx
